name: Barker, Peter K.
employer: W.M. Keck Foundation; formerly Goldman Sachs (Partner) and JPMorgan Chase (California Chairman)
title: Director / Trustee
notes: Peter K. Barker joined Goldman Sachs in 1971, became Partner in 1982 heading West Coast Investment Banking until 1998, then served as California Chairman of JPMorgan Chase 2009-2013. He now serves as Director at the W.M. Keck Foundation and President & Trustee of The Fletcher Jones Foundation.
ngos: Director, W.M. Keck Foundation; Trustee, Claremont McKenna College; Trustee, The Huntington Library; President & Trustee, The Fletcher Jones Foundation; formerly Lead Independent Director at Franklin Resources; Chair, LA Area Boy Scouts; Vice Chair, YMCA of Metropolitan Los Angeles

name: Bodman, Taylor S.
title: Partner, Head of Systems (Information Technology)
notes: Taylor Stockwell Bodman (born July 17, 1961) graduated from Princeton and joined Brown Brothers Harriman in 1983, becoming a Partner in 1999. He oversees the firm's IT/Systems division and Asia business activities, and is a member of the Executive Committee. Not related to Samuel W. Bodman, the Secretary of Energy.
ngos: Director, United Way of Massachusetts Bay and Merrimack Valley; Trustee, Kents Hill School; Trustee, Boys' Club of New York; Overseer, Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum; Advisory Board, Institute for the Recruitment of Teachers

name: Cohen, Michael B.
title: Unknown
notes: No distinct public profile found for Michael B. Cohen in Bohemian Grove-associated circles. The name is extremely common; no definitive match found in SEC EDGAR, OpenSecrets, or biographical databases.

name: Comann, Tyler K.
title: Managing Director
notes: Tyler Kent Comann (born September 14, 1950, Chicago) holds a Stanford BA (1972) and Harvard MBA (1978). He served as a Navy lieutenant, then worked at Booz Allen, Golden West Finance, and Crocker National Bank before founding his own M&A advisory firms in San Francisco. He has completed over 100 engagements totaling $1.5B in value and holds two U.S. wine-industry patents.

name: Crocker, Charles
title: Unknown
notes: Likely a descendent of the prominent Crocker banking family of San Francisco, whose fortune derived from Charles Crocker (1822-1888), co-founder of the Central Pacific Railroad and founder of Crocker First National Bank of San Francisco (ancestor of Crocker National Bank, merged with Wells Fargo in 1986). No specific public profile found for this individual member.

name: Daly, Leo A. III
employer: LEO A DALY (architecture, engineering, interior design firm)
title: Chairman and Chief Executive Officer
notes: Leo A. Daly III has served as Chairman and CEO of the Omaha-based LEO A DALY firm since 1981, succeeding his father. He holds architecture licenses in 48 states and multiple countries, is a Fellow of the American Institute of Architects and the Royal Australian Institute of Architects, and received the 2018 Joseph Miller Award from Catholic University.
ngos: Trustees' Council, National Gallery of Art; Board of Trustees, Catholic University of America; University of Nebraska Foundation; Board, US-Saudi Business Council; Counselor, Meridian House International; formerly Chairman, Asia Society Washington DC; formerly Chairman, Center for the Study of the Presidency

name: Day, Robert A.
employer: W.M. Keck Foundation (formerly TCW Group / Trust Company of the West)
title: Founder / Philanthropist (deceased 2023)
notes: Robert Addison Day (December 11, 1943 - September 14, 2023) founded the Trust Company of the West (TCW Group) in 1971 and sold 70% to Societe Generale for $2.5 billion in 2001. Grandson of Superior Oil founder William Myron Keck, he was a major Republican donor who in 2015 gave $1.1M to Super PACs backing Jeb Bush and Carly Fiorina.
ngos: W.M. Keck Foundation; Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution trustee
political_donations: Republican donor; $1.1M to Super PACs for Jeb Bush and Carly Fiorina (2015); hosted $1M Bush fundraiser (2006); economics advisor to Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger

name: DeGioia, John J.
title: President Emeritus (formerly President 2001-2024)
notes: John Joseph DeGioia served as Georgetown University's president from 2001 to November 2024, becoming the first lay president of any Jesuit university in the United States. He holds a BA and PhD in Philosophy from Georgetown. He stepped down citing health concerns.
ngos: Carnegie Corporation of New York (board); National Association of Independent Schools (board); American Council on Education (chair); Business-Higher Education Forum; American Academy of Arts and Sciences; Pulitzer Center

name: Elachi, Charles
title: Professor Emeritus of Electrical Engineering and Planetary Science; formerly Director, NASA JPL (2001-2016)
notes: Charles Elachi (born April 18, 1947, Lebanon) served as the 8th Director of NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory from 2001 to 2016, overseeing 24 missions including Mars rovers Spirit, Opportunity, and Curiosity. He established the field of spaceborne imaging radar and authored over 230 publications.
ngos: Board of Trustees, The Aerospace Corporation; St. Exupery Innovation Council (chair); UAE Space Agency International Advisory Council; Lebanese American University Board of Trustees (past chair); The Planetary Society; The Huntington Board of Governors

name: Giannini, Beau
employer: Hult International Business School; Ternary Intelligence
title: Professor; Founder and CEO
notes: Beau Giannini holds a PhD in Management Science from Tongji University and has been a professor at Hult International Business School since 2019. He is founder and CEO of Ternary Intelligence and previously founded Sinomark Consulting in 2003, focusing on US-China business.

name: Harper, Stephen S.
title: Unknown
notes: No distinct public profile found for Stephen S. Harper as a Bohemian Grove member. Searches returned primarily the former Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper (not this person).

name: Hasler, William A.
employer: Globalstar, Inc. (board); formerly Dean of UC Berkeley Haas School of Business
title: Board Member / Former Dean
notes: William A. Hasler served as Vice Chairman of KPMG Peat Marwick (1984-1991), Dean of UC Berkeley's Haas School of Business (1991-1998), and Co-CEO of Aphton Corp (1998-2004). He chaired Solectron Corporation's board (2003-2007) and currently serves on the Globalstar board.

name: Herr, Andrew F
title: Founder and CEO
notes: Andrew Herr holds multiple master's degrees in Microbiology & Immunology, Health Physics, and Security Studies from Georgetown University. He spent 7 years working with the U.S. military on human performance and biotechnology before founding Fount, a personalized performance optimization company. He is a former Adjunct Fellow at CNAS.

name: Hoefer, Kurt
title: Chief Strategy Officer
notes: Kurt Hoefer is a CFA Charterholder with a BA in Economics from Stanford University and an MBA from UCLA Anderson. He previously served as a Portfolio Manager and Research Analyst at Golub Group LLC and is Chairman of the San Mateo County Employees' Retirement Association.
ngos: Chairman, San Mateo County Employees' Retirement Association

name: Lauper, Bernard
title: Chief Operating Officer
notes: Bernard Lauper is COO at Risk Strategies after serving as CEO of MacCorkle Insurance, which was acquired by Risk Strategies in 2015. His prior roles include Chief Sales Officer at American Specialty Health and Vice President of Strategic Accounts at Kaiser Permanente.

name: Li, Eric X.
title: Founder and Managing Director
notes: Eric X. Li is a Shanghai-based venture capitalist and political scientist who founded Chengwei Capital in 2000, which has invested over $2 billion in 100+ Chinese companies. He holds degrees from UC Berkeley, Stanford GSB, and Fudan University (PhD), and is known for his pro-China political commentary and 2013 TED Talk.
ngos: Board of Directors, China Europe International Business School (CEIBS); Stanford GSB Advisory Board; Freeman Spogli Institute at Stanford; Akshaya Patra (world's largest school-feeding NGO); International Institute for Strategic Studies (IISS) Advisory Council; Democracy Culture Foundation Leadership Council

name: Lyons, Richard
title: Chancellor (12th Chancellor, appointed July 2024)
notes: Richard K. Lyons (born February 10, 1961, Palo Alto) is the first undergraduate alum to serve as UC Berkeley Chancellor, earning his BS in Economics from Berkeley in 1982 and his PhD from MIT. He previously served as Dean of the Haas School of Business (2008-2018).

name: Michael, Peter Z.
title: Founder (Sir Peter Michael)
notes: Sir Peter Michael (born c. 1938, England) is a British entrepreneur knighted in 1989 who pioneered Quantel and digital imaging technology before purchasing 630 acres in Sonoma's Knights Valley in 1982 to found Peter Michael Winery. He also co-founded Classic FM radio in the UK (1991). The winery is now run by his son Paul.

name: Mohr, Lawrence G. Jr.
title: Co-Founder and Managing Director
notes: Lawrence G. Mohr Jr. has been in venture capital since 1974. He founded Mohr Davidow Ventures in 1983 after working at Hambrecht & Quist and Bank of America. He holds an MBA and Master's in Engineering from Stanford and a BS in Engineering from Cornell, and taught entrepreneurship at Stanford GSB for three years.
ngos: President and Board Member, Stanford Athletic Department Investment Fund (DAPER)

name: Morris, Charles Kendrick
title: Unknown
notes: No distinct public profile found for Charles Kendrick Morris. The name did not surface in SEC EDGAR, OpenSecrets, or biographical databases with sufficient specificity.

name: Mullins, Brian Thayer
title: Unknown
notes: No distinct public profile found for Brian Thayer Mullins. The name did not surface in SEC EDGAR, LinkedIn, or biographical databases with sufficient specificity.

name: Oetting, David P.
title: Wealth Management Advisor, Vice President
notes: David Oetting, CFP, is a Wealth Management Advisor at Merrill Lynch based in Clayton, Missouri. He entered financial services in 2009, joined Merrill Lynch in 2010, and was named to the 2023 Forbes Best-in-State Wealth Management Teams list. He is a Vanderbilt University graduate.

name: Parma, Leon W.
title: Managing Director and Co-Founder
notes: Leon W. Parma built a career spanning banking (founder of La Jolla Bank and Trust), radio broadcasting (PAR Broadcasting), distribution (Coast Distributing - Anheuser-Busch), and sports (co-owner San Diego Padres 1990-1995). He served as Chief of Staff to Congressman Bob Wilson (1958-1962) and was a personal friend and golf partner of President Gerald Ford for five decades.
ngos: Gerald R. Ford Foundation (Trustee/Retired Trustee)

name: Paulsen, Jon H.
title: Unknown

title: Unknown

name: Sanders, Drew Yager
title: Author / Businessman
notes: Drew Yager Sanders (born c. 1970) is a 5th-generation Californian and UC Berkeley BA (History) graduate living in the San Francisco Bay Area. He has written self-improvement and business books including 'Change Doesn't Bite' (2012), 'Finding Big Mo' (2013), and 'The Next Gen Almanac' (2015).

name: Smith, Thomas M.
title: Unknown
notes: No distinct public profile found for Thomas M. Smith as a Bohemian Grove-Stowaway member. The name is extremely common and no definitive match was found.

name: Sourvinos, Socrates
employer: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Hellenic Republic
title: Consul General of Greece in San Francisco
notes: Socrates Sourvinos has served as Consul General of Greece in San Francisco since 2020. He holds an LLM from Democritus University of Thrace, an MA from Tufts University Fletcher School, and studied Negotiation and Diplomacy at Harvard Kennedy School. He previously served as Deputy Head of Mission at the Greek Embassy in the UAE (2018-2020).

name: Stafford, Robert M.
employer: Stafford Capital Management; Pacific Asset Partners
title: Founder/CEO; Managing General Partner
notes: Robert M. Stafford founded Stafford Capital Management in Sausalito, California in 1986. He previously worked as San Francisco Regional Manager at Goldman Sachs and Financial Analyst at Morgan Stanley. He holds a Princeton BA and Stanford GSB MBA, and serves as Independent Director of PASSUR Aerospace.

name: Swan, John
title: Chairman (Sir John Swan, KBE; former Premier of Bermuda 1982-1995)
notes: Sir John William David Swan KBE (born July 3, 1935) is a real estate developer who served as Premier of Bermuda from 1982 to 1995. He founded John W. Swan Ltd in 1962, which developed 40% of Bermuda's residential homes between 1968 and 1978. He has participated in the Hoover Institution, Aspen Foundation, and World Economic Forum in Davos.
ngos: Bermuda Hospitals Board (former Chairman); Aspen Institute

name: Wagner, Henry W. III
employer: UBS Financial Services / Fort Point Wealth Management
title: First Vice President - Wealth Management / Senior Portfolio Manager
notes: Henry 'Hank' Wagner III is a UC Berkeley graduate (Political Economics, 1978) who began his investment career in 1979 with Dean Witter Reynolds in San Francisco. He later joined a San Francisco investment advisory firm as EVP and moved to UBS in 2011 as part of the Fort Point Wealth Management team.

name: Armstrong, David A.
title: Unknown
notes: No distinct public profile found for David A. Armstrong as a Bohemian Grove-Wayside Log member. Multiple people with this name exist in law, theater, and technology, but no definitive match was found.

name: Avlon, John P.
title: Senior Political Analyst and Anchor (former); 2024 Democratic Congressional Candidate, NY-1
notes: John Avlon served as CNN's senior political analyst and anchor from 2018 to 2024 and previously as editor-in-chief of The Daily Beast (2013-2018). He began as a speechwriter for Mayor Rudy Giuliani. In 2024 he ran unsuccessfully for Congress in New York's 1st District. He is married to Margaret Hoover.
ngos: Co-founder (2010), No Labels (501(c)(4) bipartisan political group); left No Labels in 2013
political_donations: 2024 Democratic congressional candidate, NY-1 (lost to Republican Nick LaLota)

name: Balletto, John G.
title: Founder and Owner
notes: John Balletto took over his family's five-acre farm at age 17 in 1977 and built it into the largest vegetable farm in Northern California (700 acres, 70 vegetable varieties). After three successive El Nino crop failures in 1998, he transitioned to wine grapes, releasing the first Balletto Vineyards vintage in 2001. Today the estate encompasses 600 acres in Russian River Valley.
ngos: Donated 4 acres to Sonoma County Open Space District; donated land for farmworker baseball field

name: Brinkley, Douglas
title: Katherine Tsanoff Brown Chair in Humanities; Professor of History; CNN Presidential Historian
notes: Douglas Brinkley (born December 14, 1960) joined Rice University in 2007 and serves as CNN's presidential historian. He has written over 20 books, with six named NYT Notable Books of the Year and seven becoming NYT bestsellers. He received a Grammy Award for Presidential Suite and seven honorary doctorates.
ngos: Trustee, Theodore Roosevelt Presidential Library Foundation; Trustee, Madison Council at the Library of Congress; Trustee, National Archives Foundation; Trustee, Bruce Springsteen Archives; Trustee, Woody Guthrie Center; Trustee, Bob Dylan Center

name: Buffett, Jimmy
title: Musician, Songwriter, Businessman
notes: Jimmy Buffett (December 25, 1946 - September 1, 2023) was one of the most commercially successful singer-songwriters in American history, best known for 'Margaritaville' (1977). He sold over 20 million records across 29 studio albums and built the Margaritaville brand into a hospitality and consumer products empire. Posthumously inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2024.

name: Butcher, Preston
employer: Legacy Partners (formerly Lincoln Property Company N.C., Inc.)
title: Chairman
notes: C. Preston Butcher (born 1939) earned a BS in Electrical Engineering from University of Texas (1962) and built Lincoln Property Company's Western Region into one of the largest residential real estate operations in the U.S. He founded Legacy Partners in 1998 by buying the Western division, developing over 78,000 housing units exceeding $8 billion in cost.
ngos: Co-founder and past Chairman, National Multi Housing Council; Co-founder and Director, California Housing Council; Founding board member, BRIDGE Housing (nonprofit); Policy Advisory Board, Fisher Center for Real Estate at UC Berkeley; past Overseer, Hoover Institution Stanford; past Trustee, Urban Land Institute (ULI)

name: Campbell, Blake
title: Unknown
notes: No distinct public profile found for Blake Campbell as a Bohemian Grove-Wayside Log member. Multiple executives with this name exist but no definitive match was identified.

name: Cay, John E. III
employer: Cay Insurance; formerly Wells Fargo Insurance Services (Vice Chairman)
title: Chairman; formerly Vice Chairman
notes: John Eugene Cay III (UNC-Chapel Hill 1968) succeeded his father as President and CEO of Palmer & Cay at age 27, growing it into one of the largest privately held insurance brokerage firms in the U.S. In 2005, Palmer & Cay merged with Wachovia (later Wells Fargo) Insurance Services. He has over 40 years of executive insurance leadership.
ngos: Board Chair, Director or Member of more than 30 non-profit organizations over his career; Girl Scouts of the USA Honorary Trustee

name: Church, Eric
title: Country Music Singer/Songwriter
notes: Kenneth Eric Church (born May 3, 1977, Granite Falls, NC) is a Grammy-nominated country music star whose 2011 album Chief debuted at #1 on both country and Billboard 200 charts. He won the CMA Entertainer of the Year in 2020 and is known for his signature aviator sunglasses. His eighth studio album, Evangeline vs. the Machine, was released May 2025.
political_donations: No FEC records found; known as politically independent; critical of the NRA after 2017 Las Vegas shooting

name: Colman, Robert S.
title: Unknown

name: Cummins, Donal Casey
title: Principal Attorney (Family Law)
notes: Donal Casey Cummins earned his BA in Business Administration from Gonzaga University and his JD from University of San Francisco School of Law (1970). He founded the Law Offices of Cummins & Holmes in San Ramon, California in 1971, specializing in family law. He has served as a Judge Pro Tem in Contra Costa County Superior Court.

name: Dennis, Harry L. E.
title: Unknown
notes: No distinct public profile found for Harry L.E. Dennis as a Bohemian Grove-Wayside Log member. L. Franklyn Elliott (see separate entry) is a plastic surgeon in Atlanta, not necessarily the same.

name: Duboc, Robert M. Jr.
title: Unknown
notes: Robert M. Duboc Jr. has filed patents in display technology and spatial light modulators. His father Robert Duboc (1927-2023) was a Kansas City attorney who graduated from University of Kansas and Michigan Law School. No confirmed employer or title found for the Bohemian Grove member.

name: Dutra, Randal M.
title: Painter, Sculptor, and Visual Effects Artist
notes: Randal M. Dutra (born 1958, California) works in impressionism/realism in painting and sculpture. He began his film career as a creature technician on Return of the Jedi (1983) and received two Academy Award nominations for visual effects on Jurassic Park II: The Lost World and War of the Worlds. He is a member of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

name: Edelman, David
employer: MIT Internet Policy Research Initiative; Anzu Partners
title: Director, Project on Technology Economy and National Security; Partner
notes: R. David Edelman served as Special Assistant to the President for Economic and Technology Policy at the White House National Economic Council (2011-2017), co-authoring the nation's first International Strategy for Cyberspace and first AI policy. He holds a BA from Yale and MA/DPhil from Oxford (Clarendon Scholar).
ngos: Brookings Institution (senior fellow); MIT CSAIL and Center for International Studies

name: Elliott, L. Franklyn
employer: Atlanta Plastic Surgery, PC; Northside Hospital
title: Plastic and Reconstructive Surgeon
notes: L. Franklyn Elliott, MD has been board-certified by the American Board of Plastic Surgery since 1984. He is world-renowned for contributions to cosmetic and reconstructive surgery, including advances in breast reconstruction and the TRAM flap method. He served as Program Chairman of the Breast Surgery Symposium in Atlanta from 1988 to 2004.

name: Eng, Kevin K.
title: Unknown
notes: No distinct public profile found for Kevin K. Eng as a Bohemian Grove-Wayside Log member. A Kevin D. Eng (different middle initial) is CEO/CIO of Columbus Hill Capital Management, but it is uncertain if this is the same person.

name: Feld, Alan D.
employer: Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP
title: Senior Executive Partner
notes: Alan D. Feld joined Akin Gump in 1960 and is one of four Senior Executive Partners at the firm, which bears his name. He has more than 60 years of experience in corporate finance and securities law. In 1985, he was appointed by the Texas Governor to the Texas State Securities Board, serving as Chairman through 1991. He received the 2018 Texas Lawyer Lifetime Achievement Award.
ngos: SMU Trustee Emeritus (one of only 11 in university history); SMU Law School Professorship named in his honor

name: Gilligan, Patrick
title: President and Chief Executive Officer (as of June 2025)
notes: Patrick Gilligan (Holy Cross BA, Mathematics, 1986) has over 25 years in health plan leadership. He previously served as Chief Commercial Officer at Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts and held senior positions at CVS Health and Partners HealthCare before becoming CEO of Point32Health (formerly BCBS Massachusetts) in June 2025.
ngos: Board member, The Blue Venture Fund; Cobalt Benefits Group

name: Harrison, Walter F. III
title: Unknown

name: Hussman, Walter E. Jr.
title: Chairman (retired as Publisher of Arkansas Democrat-Gazette, January 2023)
notes: Walter E. Hussman Jr. (born January 5, 1947) is a third-generation Arkansas newspaper publisher who built the Arkansas Democrat-Gazette into the state's largest newspaper through a famous 1980s newspaper war. He retired as publisher in January 2023 after 48 years and donated $20 million to name the Hussman School of Journalism at UNC-Chapel Hill.
ngos: Board of Directors, The Associated Press (2000-2009); Board, C-SPAN (1995-2003); Arkansas Arts Center board; Arkansas Repertory Theater board; Arkansas Symphony Orchestra Society board; Chairman, P.A.R.K. Foundation; President, Donaghey Foundation; Winrock International
political_donations: Known for advocating journalism standards; WEHCO Media is privately held (no SEC filings)

name: Layng, John Gardiner

name: Lindstrom, Gregory P.
title: Mediator/Arbitrator; formerly Partner, Latham & Watkins
notes: Gregory P. Lindstrom (born August 4, 1953, Hollywood) graduated from UCLA summa cum laude in 1975 and attended University of Chicago Law School. He spent 30 years at Latham & Watkins (partner 1986, Managing Partner of San Francisco office), specializing in complex litigation including antitrust and securities fraud. He was co-lead counsel in the landmark US v. Oracle (2004). He has been a full-time mediator and arbitrator since 2012.

name: MacDonnell, Miles C.
title: Owner and Co-COO
notes: Miles C. MacDonnell is the owner and Co-COO of Round Pond Estate, a 468-acre family winery in Rutherford, Napa Valley. He holds a psychology and economics degree from Southern Methodist University and an MBA from Boston College (2005). Before joining the family winery in 2001 he worked at Deloitte in Assurance & Advisory Services.

name: McLaughlin, Stuart
title: Partner
notes: Stuart 'Stu' McLaughlin (Williams College BA, History, 1994) began his career as a McKinsey analyst, then spent two years in venture capital before earning his Stanford MBA. He is a Partner at Sansome Partners, a small investment firm in San Francisco.

name: O'Leary, William F.
title: Unknown

name: Parker, Joseph L. Jr.
title: Unknown
notes: Joseph L. Parker Jr. of Tulsa, Oklahoma was appointed as an Oklahoma State Regent by Governor Brad Henry in May 2005, serving a nine-year term ending in 2014. No further confirmed employer or title found.
ngos: Oklahoma State Regents for Higher Education (Regent 2005-2014)

name: Parsons, Travis M.

name: Precourt, Jay Anthony Jr.
title: Founder, Majority Owner and CEO (Austin FC)
notes: Jay Anthony Precourt Jr. (also known as Anthony Precourt) is the son of late oil executive Jay A. Precourt (1937-2024). He holds a BA from Pepperdine and an MBA from Dartmouth Tuck. He founded Precourt Capital Management in 2008, then created Precourt Sports Ventures in 2012, owning the Columbus Crew before founding Austin FC (the 27th MLS franchise) in 2019.

name: Reynolds, Robert Joseph
title: Unknown
notes: No distinct public profile found for Robert Joseph Reynolds as a Bohemian Grove-Wayside Log member.

name: Spieker, Warren 'Ned' E. Jr.
employer: Spieker Realty Investments; Continuing Life (CCRC developer)
title: Managing Partner; Chairman
notes: Warren 'Ned' Spieker Jr. founded Spieker Properties in 1987 and took it public as a REIT in 1993, growing it into the largest REIT in the Western U.S. (42 million sq ft). He sold Spieker Properties to Sam Zell's Equity Office Properties Trust in 2001 for over $7 billion. He is a Haas School alumnus who donated $30 million to UC Berkeley Haas and $26 million to Cal Men's Aquatics.
ngos: UC Berkeley Foundation Trustee; Haas School of Business Advisory Board; Urban Land Institute (ULI) past Board of Trustees

name: Ullyot, Theodore Warren
title: Executive Vice President and General Counsel
notes: Ted Ullyot (Harvard BA magna cum laude 1990; University of Chicago Law JD 1994) clerked for Justice Antonin Scalia and served as Associate Counsel in the Bush White House and Chief of Staff to Attorney General Gonzales. He was Facebook's General Counsel (2008-2013), then joined Andreessen Horowitz, co-founded Torridon Law with former AG William Barr, and became NFL's top lawyer in 2023.
ngos: Co-Chairman, Federalist Society Board of Visitors; George W. Bush Presidential Center (advisory roles)
political_donations: Known Republican-affiliated; worked in Bush White House; co-founded Torridon Law with former AG William Barr
